definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: The candidate's campaign was attended with too much ballyhoo .
sentences.chinese: 这个候选人的竞选活动致力于太多的大举造势。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked in great numbers but our men stood their ground.
sentences.chinese: 敌人大举进攻，但我方战士仍坚守阵地。

sentences.english: All the stuff we need to create a computerized mass invasion of the beach.
sentences.chinese: 用计算机制作大举进攻海滩所需的一切都搞定了。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked in great numbers but our soldiers stood their ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们的前哨被迫撤回，预示敌人即将大举进攻。

sentences.english: A speculative frenzy of borrowing and bidding up is at work.
sentences.chinese: 大举贷款，哄抬物价，这些投机行为日渐疯狂。

sentences.english: Under the influence of market pessimism, empty main is big gallon.
sentences.chinese: 受市场悲观情绪影响，空方主力更是大举加仓。

sentences.english: It will be Buffett's second major foray into Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 这是巴菲特第二次大举进攻华尔街。

sentences.english: Soon cameras massive imports, domestic cameras will face a new test.
sentences.chinese: 进口相机大举压境，国产相机将面临新的考验。

sentences.english: The lugouqiao incident broke out in 1937, the Japanese invading China.
sentences.chinese: 1937年卢沟桥事变爆发，日本大举入侵中国。

sentences.english: 《9》 China, Fujian Province Fuzhou first session lantern festival in south back street grand hold.
sentences.chinese: 中国，福建省福州市首届灯会在南后街盛大举行。

sentences.english: These are the things the main forces of the Red Army must attend to on the eve of a large-scale enemy offensive.
sentences.chinese: 这是在敌人大举进攻的前夜主力红军的必要的处置。

sentences.english: Arezzo begun to attack more and we sat further back.
sentences.chinese: 阿雷佐开始大举进攻，我们更加退后。

sentences.english: Is the US girding its loins for another great crusade against evil?
sentences.chinese: 美国是会为了再一次大举讨伐邪恶而摩拳擦掌？

sentences.english: Many candidates ballyhoo their campaigning in the street.
sentences.chinese: 许多候选人在街上为他们的竞选活动大举造势。

sentences.english: CCB wasn't interested in expanding very much in developed countries, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，建设银行没有兴趣在发达国家大举扩张业务。

definition: to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
